title: orbital status should filter to active builds by default
description: Currently 'orbital status' dumps the full build history (139+ rows). For monitoring, the default should show only running/pending builds. Add --history or --all flag for the full table. This saves parsing effort for callers like liaison-check.

title: Add Xcode build support to Orbital
description:
Extend Orbital to delegate Xcode builds from Linux containers to the macOS host, mirroring the existing Gradle delegation pattern. Xcode is macOS-only so this is the only path for iOS builds from containers.

Key work:
- Add 'xcode' build type to server with scheme/destination validation
- Add 'orbital xcode <project> <scheme> [--destination ...]' client subcommand
- Artifact collection for .app, .ipa, .xcarchive, .dSYM
- Allowlist pod install / swift package resolve as pre-build commands
- Map signing_profile to Xcode provisioning profiles / code signing identities
- Xcode-specific security checks (build settings injection prevention)

The core protocol (HTTP + SSE streaming, workspace rsync, artifact management) is already build-system agnostic.

title: Orbital: no way to sync out-of-tree dependencies
description:
Orbital only rsyncs the project directory to the host workspace. Relative paths escaping the project tree (e.g. ../../../love/crew/lovelace for LOVE_DIR) resolve to nothing on the host. Need a mechanism like orbital.includes manifest or --extra-sync-path to declare additional paths.

Workaround: copying .so files in-tree or using published/ artifacts.
